comment: If you are willing to study, it is very doable. the course includes only three tests. I got a 95 on my final exam, and two 79's on my first two test. The problem was thinking that I was doing enough studying. towards the end I knew what to expect, so I studied way more for the final and did very well. 100% lecture, 100% notes, very good professor.

He is a nice person, but not a great professor. You can tell he cares about U.S. history, specifically southern U.S. history, but he just isn't great at getting his point across. He is very understanding usually. I wouldn't recommend him unless you have perfect attendance and enjoy going to long lectures.

Professor Wills is so knowledgeable about what he teaches and is very in-depth regardless if the class is engaging or not. There was a few tests which were insanely easy if you went to lecture. He quite literally helps you during the exam. Amazing teacher.

Dr. Wills is an acquired taste. He is certainly knowledgable on southern history, but he is unclear with instructions and difficult to follow. He also has a major God complex and doesn't seem to respect female students. He's passive aggressive and won't accept work online under any circumstances, even if you're puking. Not for the faint of heart.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You only have 3 grades throughout the whole semester. You will not know your grade until it gets close to the end. One positive is that he is a very caring professor and does want you to pass, but the class is just lecture-based. Also, the study guide will just be filled with 100 terms with no words on them. I would not recommend.

Do not take this man if at all possible. There were only two graded assignments throughout the semester which he gives no feedback on. There were other participation assignments scattered throughout the class as well. The problem here is that he is anti-email and refuses to accept email submissions despite this class being taken in the pandemic.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Two tests, and participation. Tests are weighted heavily on the essay portion. Just about everyone seemed to score the same on the essay he gives feedback, but the essay grade felt arbitrary. Three weeks of content covered on the last lecture day. Questions asked is mostly trivia like remembering exact quotes. No grades posted online.

Dr Wills is a walking encyclopedia of the Civil War and early American history. This fact comes out whenever he is lecturing since he can go on about a single topic for over half of class . He is a great guy and is always willing to talk after class if you don't get something. If you're passionate about the civil war or American history take him.

DO NOT TAKE! As I feel he had good intentions, he constantly beat around the bush in his lectures. Grade consists of 3 tests and participation. His "study guide" are just terms sheets where he didn't even go over most of them. It was RARE if anyone got an A on an exam. He stated that we were are own curve. Save your time & stress. Dont take him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Not the best, not the worst. He is super boring. I'm talking put you to sleep boring, but he literally gave us the questions that were going to be on the test in a study session he held for us. If you ask a question during the exam he basically TELLS you the answer. He wants you to do good. He gets mad if you're late, & starts class early.

His class is all lectures that are long and boring. He often reads directly from the textbook in class. We only had a few grades, (Midterm, paper, and Final). I would not take this class, unless I absolutely had to. Very strict about being on time, but starts class early and gets out late.

Professor Wills gives amazing lectures on whatever course he's teaching and is very open-minded. He doesn't like phones out and he's strick on attendance. His lectures are so fun and he's really funny! He's also a civil war author and knows so much about what he teaches. He gives you a lot of material to help you understand what's going on in class

Do not take this professor! He does not manage his time well, the class I took was called "The Old South" more like we cover the founding of America up to the civil war. And when we finally got to the civil war, we covered 1863-1865 in 40 minutes I did not feel like his "teaching" prepared me for his tests, or that I learned a single thing

He's knowledgeable, hilarious, and he seems to be a caring man. Not at all like the other reviewers have stated. However, he didn't manage his time well, and we had to cover all of Reconstruction in a day. I also felt he could have been clearer about his expectations on the tests. Not terrible, but not the best professor I've ever had.
Must attend class in order to understand the test. More studying in this class than I have ever done in my whole student career

Terrible. Sexist against females, wont answer questions, thinks he is God in his classroom, does not teach the material. The class was about Civil War and Reconstruction, and did not even get to the surrender. Very rude, inconsistant, and unfortubately ruined a great class.

Very tough, I avoided a class this semester just because he was the prof. Seemed unorganized and we got behind quickly. Strict grading, funny sometimes but don't be late or get on his bad side, he will ride you the whole semester. Lectured every day, sometimes on irrelevant details. Tests a mixture of choice, short answer, essays. Didn't need books

Worst Prof I have ever had.  Goes off on tangents about sports, unorganized, hard grader.  Grades: midterm, final and participation (but hardly takes attendance so not sure how calculated) Mean, never seen a Prof get so nasty with students and seemed to have no use for female students at all.  Knowledgeable but unpleasant. Avoid like the plague.
